intro: Erythrostemon exostemma, commonly known as the redstem mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, often pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, with hairy stems and palmately lobed leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for gardens and ecological studies.
